bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. NOEM:H.R. 1894.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 3, which delegates power toCongress ``To regulate Commerce with foreign Nations, andamong the several States, and with the Indian Tribes''[Page H2535]

item.title: Federal Agriculture Reform and Risk Management Act of 2013

latestAction.text: On passage Failed by recorded vote: 195 - 234 (Roll no. 286).

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Department Operations, Oversight, and Nutrition.
Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.

summary.text: Amends the Department of Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994 to establish an Office of Tribal Relations within the Office of the Secretary of Agriculture (USDA) to advise the Secretary on policies related to Indian tribes.

bill.title: To establish an Office of Tribal Relations in the Department of Agriculture.

item.title: To establish an Office of Tribal Relations in the Department of Agriculture.
To establish an Office of Tribal Relations in the Department of Agriculture.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Department Operations, Oversight, and Nutrition.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
